Posts.Content: Hi All And thank you for the support. I had been reading alot prior to the surgery date and questioned the Doctors office about any needed prep or tests prior to the surgery date and was told that unless they suspected something (which with me they didn't) they do there testing the the day of the surgery. The Anesthesiologist said my blood work and blood pressure were great but the last test was the EKG. They said if they had a Cardiologist at the hospital and gave an ok they still could have gone ahead with the surgery but none available. So.. they made me an appointment next Tuesday and said as soon as I was cleared they would reschedule. I still have good hopes and feel much better then I did a couple days ago. Again Thank you all.
Posts.Title: Sigh..

Posts.Content: Well I went in for my Da vinci surgery this morning and was about to be taken back and the Anesthesiologist said everything looked good except my EKG. The doctor said I have atrial fibrillation and redid my EKG which came back the same. My surgeon came in and said they would refer me to a Cardiologist and once I was treated and cleared I could have the surgery. If not I would have to go with the Radiation. So.. I will let you know down the road what happens. Best to every one else.
Posts.Title: Sigh..

Posts.Content: Well 2 more days before Da vinci surgery. My grown Daughter seen me reading more on it and said "DAD! you need the surgery. Quit trying to get out of it" LOL. I said I know, I am just nervous and making sure I am prepared. My Family is very supportive. Was wondering though. Do I buy Depends and pads before my surgery? Do I need Depends at all or just pads? Also thanks to all who voiced in about my time off work in an earlier thread. I do Handyman work and my customers are prepared for my time off. 7 of 12 cores positive 5 - 3+3=6 2 - 3+4=7
Posts.Title: 2 more days before surgery

Posts.Content: Hello and thank you all for the comments. I have read them all several times and they have led me to further reading. (I haven't read this much in a long time) I am still undecided but am leaning towards the surgery because of stop and start urinating and low flow. It is not to serious but is troublesome. My wife will go with what ever I decide but likes the surgery option also. We both also have confident feelings about the urologist. I still have some questions for him though. Questions as mentioned above by njs. I will update this when I know more. Again thank you all for the support.
Posts.Title: undecided

Posts.Content: Hello This is my first post. Age 59. PSA of 4.7 on 9/14/2014, PSA of 6.3 on 11/12/2014. Urologist performed DRE and said slightly enlarged but was fairly confident that nothing would be found in a biopsy. Biopsy performed on 12/16/2014. 12 samples, 5 benign 7 positive with the highest being 3+4=7 in 2 cores. the rest were 3+3=6. Cancer seems to be confined to prostate. Negative bone scan. He suggested RP but also gave me a brochure to Cyberknife (SBRT). I did a lot of reading and decided to go with the Cyberknife until I had my appointment to talk with the Oncologist. The Dr. said he was surprised that I would consider it over surgery considering my age and my cancer being considered of medium risk. He also said that he would want to do HT for about a year. The HT was nothing I had considered. I read up on the side effects and I talked with the wife and grown Daughter and they both said I was moody enough and depressed enough already(which is true) to have the HT. I called the Dr. and asked if I could do the SBRT without the HT. He said I could but strongly advised against it. I thought OK I will have the surgery. I then talked to my Urologist and told him this and he didn't understand why the oncologist would not want me to do it without the HT saying that the cancer was on the low side of medium risk. He also said he would do the surgery without the HT. BTW both DR.s have very good reputations and several awards in their fields and I researched them both and found no bad reviews. Sorry for the babbling but just going a bit nuts trying to decide which way to go. So if anyone has any comments I would sure appreciate it
Posts.Title: undecided

Posts.Title: undecided

Posts.Content: Hi all Well about a week before Da vinci surgery. A bit nervous but coming to grips. Can anyone give an approximation of how long I should expect to be off work? I am a self employed Handyman, so lots of lifting,bending and climbing. I am in ok shape for 59. Alot of wear and tear for the 40+ years of physical labor though. Any input would be appreciated.
Posts.Title: How long off work?

Posts.Content: Hello everyone I scheduled Da vinci surgery for 03/31/2015. I posted a couple months ago and since have read everything I can about surgery vs. SBRT and decided on surgery. Mainly because the Radiation oncologist told me I would need to take HT for up to 9 months and also suggested the surgery over the radiation. I told my Urologist and reminded him of past abdominal surgeries (splenectomy, a brief colostomy and double hernia which were like 30 years ago) and he said that since he only did open surgery that he did not feel confident doing the surgery. I did however get the chief of Urology at one of the hospitals to agree to do the Da vinci but said once he gets in if there is to much scar tissue he would have to close me up and I would have to do radiation instead. I guess I am not so nervous about the surgery but the after effects. I am not looking for answers but just needed to vent a bit. 59 years old PSA 6.7 6 of 12 cores positive 5 of 6 cores 3+3=6 1 core 3+4=7 from 2% to 90%
Posts.Title: Nervous, 2nd thoughts

Posts.Content: Thanks very much for the replies, the reassurance and comfort is most welcome.

Posts.Title: Nervous, 2nd thoughts

Posts.Content: Wow! This was a really nice post. These are all things running through my mind.I have been running all this through my head for months now. I was just about to be taken back for my De vinci surgery a few weeks ago when I was told I had AFIB and the Doctors halted the surgery until I could have more test done. Results are permanent AFIB but my heart is good enough for the prostate surgery. So I am scheduled on May 12th and once again getting my mind all psyched up for it. This post helps. Thanks again.
Posts.Title: Update: 7 weeks out - progress

Posts.Title: Update: 7 weeks out - progress

Posts.Content: LOL. Sorry it was March 31st but good catch.
Posts.Title: 2.5 Days to go

Posts.Content: Well going in for daVinci surgery soon. Went in on April 31st but was turned away just before surgery due to AFIB. Heart doctor gave the ok and back on track. If the Surgeon can get through my old scars from years ago from several surgeries. I will be ok. from what the doctor said it has been growing inside me for several years so I am hoping they get it all the first time. I want to thank everyone for their helpful posts and what to expect before and after surgery. This site has been more helpful then the cancer and doctors sites on the web. Thanks again. 6 of 12 cores positive 3+4=7 Bi lateral cores from 2%-90%
Posts.Title: 2.5 Days to go

Posts.Content: Sorry Didee I didn't mean to get on a subject that wasn't allowed. I think I just wanted to hear the answers that were given to reassure myself. I am certainly going ahead with my surgery. Just nervous. I had my surgery canceled because of AFIB about 5 weeks ago and had to go through all the waiting and worrying again. but all the posts and stickies help. Thanks all.
Posts.Title: Alternative Medicine?

Posts.Content: Well once again De vinci surgery is coming close (May 12th) and in the last couple of weeks I have had several people trying to talk me out of it saying that they know people who have had their cancer cured by alternative doctors. (Hoxsey in Mexico for 1 place). From what I find they don't hold any real proof of cures except people saying that they were cured. Just wondering if anyone on here has had any luck with alternative medicine? BTW my wife and Children all are for the surgery not wanting for me to take any chances. 08/14 psa 4.7 10/14 psa 6.3 12/14 biopsy 6 of 12 cores positive bi lateral 4 cores 3+3=6 2 cores 3+4=7 from 2% to 90%
